# <span style="color:grey;font-size:0.5em;line-height:1.0; display:inline-block;"> Research Project,<br> School of Geography, University of Leeds </span>
<font face="Segoe UI" size=20px> **Analysing Global Policy Responses to COVID-19** </font>
<!-- Project 1 -->

## Background
- <span style="font-size:80%;">Studying rapid decisions to inform future responses to similar crises.</span>
- <span style="font-size:80%;">Identify gaps in preparedness and areas for improvement.</span>
- <span style="font-size:80%;">Evaluate the effectiveness of different strategies and inform the development of policies and procedures to better handle future emergencies.</span>

**_RQ: What mechanisms drive the rapid and homogeneous diffusion of lockdown policies across heterogeneous countries, and how can these mechanisms be captured through agent-based simulation?_**

## Methodology
::: panel-tabset
### Agent Characteristics
::: {.html}
<div style="transform: scale(0.9); transform-origin: top left;">
<table>
  <thead>
  <tr>
    <th>Attributes</th>
    <th>Characteristics</th>
  </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
  <tr>
    <td>GDP</td>
    <td>National income per country that is read from data</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Democracy</td>
    <td>Democracy index per country that is read from data</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Population Density</td>
    <td>Average Population density per country that is read from data</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Covid Cases</td>
    <td>Covid Cases per thousand population (normalized on average)</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Initial State of policy</td>
    <td>Adopted policy measure on March 1, 2020</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Distance (Minimum Difference)</td>
    <td>Key variable of the model in that defines the distance between some agent and all other agents</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Social Threshold</td>
    <td>A parameter incorporated to influence the policy adoption of the agent. The parameter is calculated based on the following equation:
    $$
    ST = e^{\text{Covid Cases}} \times (\text{Base Threshold})^{2} \times \text{Lockdown Adoption Probability}
    $$
    </td>
  </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>

:::
### Model Framework
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
![](./media/Cov_ABM.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=70% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:40%; font-size: 50%;margin-left:44rem;margin-top:-4rem;"}
:::{.incremental}
**Base threshold:**

  - A parameter introduced to affect the social threshold value of the countries
  - Ranges from 0.02 to 0.25
  - Optimal value 0.13
:::
:::{.incremental}
**Peer size:**

  - The number of countries effective in influencing policy decision.
  - Ranges from 10 to 25.
  - Optimal value 18.
:::
:::{.incremental}
**Lockdown adoption probability:**

  - The probability of countries to adopt a lockdown on their own.
  - Ranges from 0.0002 to 0.07.
  - Optimal value 0.01.
:::

# <span style="color:grey;font-size:0.5em;line-height:1.0; display:inline-block;"> PhD Research Project,<br> IIT, Kharagpur & Curtin University </span>
<font face="Segoe UI" size=100> **A Simulation-based assessment of demand-supply interactions for Ridesourcing services in an urban environment** </font>

## Background
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/RC1.gif){.r-stretch .absolute .fragment width=100% height=auto}
:::
::: {.column .fragment style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;background-color:rgba(234, 237, 238, 0.7);position:relative; z-index:999;" .incremental}
- Demand-supply imbalance
- Increases overall VKTs of ridesourcing vehicles compared to the passenger using his or her personal vehicle to conduct the same trip 
- Competition with other motorised modes
- The operation of the TNCs are yet to have a clear picture before the regulators, making it difficult for the regulators to define these services within suitable legal framework (Flores & Rayle, 2017).

:::
::::

## Research Question {style="font-size:80%"}
- Which operational parameters are most critical for evaluating the performance and efficiency of ridesourcing systems?
- How do driver behavioural characteristics influence the dynamics of ridesourcing operations? What are the threshold values for driver idle waiting time after completing a trip? What strategies do drivers adopt for passenger search once their waiting time tolerance is exceeded?
- How do user behavioural traits affect their tolerance for waiting in ridesourcing systems? What is the threshold limit for user waiting time?
- How do different passenger search strategies and ride-matching algorithms affect system performance in simulated scenarios?

# <span style="color:grey;font-size:0.5em;line-height:1.0; display:inline-block;"> Research Project,<br> ITS, University of Leeds </span>
<font face="Segoe UI" size=100> **Where do e-cargo bikes go?** </font>

## Research Question
![](./media/GPS_flowchart.png){width=100% height=auto style="overflow: hidden;display: block; margin: 0 auto;" }

## Challenges

- Problematic points
- Discrepancy between datasets
- Missing information

## Methodology
::: panel-tabset
### Phantom Bikes
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/PB_flow.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=50% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;" .incremental}
- The bike is moving but the route points are being recorded in the wrong place
- Records random “Dodgy” or erroneous coordinates
- Conditions based on rolling average distance, speed to next point and time difference

:::
::::
### Time to First Fix-I
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/TTFF_flow_1.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=50% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;" .incremental}
- Bike not moving; but the GPS records points in the wrong place. 
- GPS receiver tries to acquire navigation data and estimates a position.
- Filter points based on whether the point is random compared to its neighbours

:::
::::
### Time to First Fix-II
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/TTFF_flow_2.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=50% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;" .incremental}
- Issues with GPS signal; May have occurred due to GPS device not being turned on.
- Missing information on route
- Search and insert missing points if available
:::
::::
### Motion Map Gap
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/MMG_flow.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=50% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;" .incremental}
- Bike is on the move; Interference with GPS signal.
- Missing information on route
- Search and insert missing points if available
:::
::::
### Speedy Bikes
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/SB_flow.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=50% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;" .incremental}
- Speed of the bikes higher than usual
- Bikes being transported in car/train
- Incorrect information on route
- Update speed and identify whether the vehicle was being transported

:::
::::
### Trip Segmentation
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/TS_flow.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=45% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;" .incremental}
- Identifying trips from the cleaned GPS points
- Identification of stop criteria
- Tsui (2005) suggested dwell time between trips can vary from 120s to 600s.

:::
::::
### Elevation Gain
::::{.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](./media/EG_flow.png){.r-stretch .absolute width=50% height=auto}
:::

::: {.column style="width:50%;font-size: 70%;margin-left:33rem;" .incremental}
- Use <font color="red">OS Terrain 50 DEM</font> – an open dataset that is more accurate than often used NASA SRTM data 
- Use R _Extract_ function – adds Elevation value to the SF dataframe of route points
- Calculate elevation gain/descent for each trip

:::
::::
:::
